text: [AUDIO LOGO]

JOSEPH LAPIN: My
name is Joseph Lapin.

And what I really care about
is storytelling and design

thinking to drive growth
and make meaningful impact
in people's lives.

When I first sort of started
realizing how passionate I

was about storytelling,
I think, started way back

in the beginning of
my journey in college
at Stetson University.

And I went on and got an
MFA in creative writing

at Florida International
University.

What got out of that
MFA was something
I never would have expected.

And my professor,
Les Standiford, he

taught me about Joseph Campbell
and The Hero's Journey.

And Joseph Campbell
and The Hero's Journey

is the philosophy and
foundation and architecture
of storytelling.

So I graduated from a
MFA, and I met my wife

and moved out to my wife
in Los Angeles where
I was a journalist.

And really was putting
this storytelling practice

to a practical use of
society as a journalist.

But what I found was that
still it wasn't really
the end of my journey.
I needed to keep going.
I needed to keep going.

I was doing a lot of
research on design thinking.

And ultimately
landed on Stanford,

their Entrepreneurship
Innovation Program.
And I just called up.

And they're like listen,
you want design thinking,
this is the program for you.

But let me tell you it's
only the beginning for you.

So I think design thinking was
to keep the Joseph Campbell
analogy going.
That was the call to adventure.

Everything that I'm doing
professionally and creatively

has been impacted
by this program.

I literally have
transformed the way

I approach leadership, creative
thinking, team building,

collaboration, based on
not only the research

that I came across but the
philosophies and the thinking.

There was always a part of
me growing up in my town

in Clinton, Massachusetts
where I'm from.

I always knew I
thought differently.

Through this Entrepreneurship
and Innovation Program,

what I learned was
that motivating factor,

that part of me was something
that could be my superpower.

And ultimately, I believe
that I can do that
through storytelling.

But now, I'm seeing
I could do that
through product development.

And really what
I'm trying to do is

I'm building an integrative
marketing company.

I want to build a
journey for individuals

to help them become the
people they're meant to be.

There's themes running
through these programs
of great companies.

I feel that I've seen a vision
for how a company should work.

I have seen, by just listening
to the stories and the people

in this program,
how amazing it could

be to run a company
that is focused

on design thinking and
creative potential.

That's what motivates me is
leaving an impact and building

something where other
people can unleash
their creative potential.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
